intro: Reseda saadae, commonly known as the Saadae catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other well-known plants like carnations and sweet William. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Reseda saadae is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
